## 사건 정보

**사건명**: People v. Neal.
**판결일**: 1939-09-05
**법원**: Michigan Supreme Court
**관할**: Michigan, MI

**판사**: Bushnell, Butzel, Chandler, McAllister, North, Potter, Sharpe, Wiest

## 변호인

N. George Bashara , for appellant.

 Thomas Read , Attorney General,  Duncan C. McCrea , Prosecuting Attorney, and  William L. Brunner  and  Allen J. Asam , Assistant Prosecuting Attorneys, for the people.

## 인용

- 287 N.W. 403
- 290 Mich. 123

## 판결문 요약

Charged with assault upon his wife, with intent to kill and murder, defendant, upon trial by jury, was convicted of felonious assault. Defendant for some years was a member of the Detroit police department, starting as a patrolman and later *Page 125 
promoted to detective, police bureau of censors. He resigned from the police department in 1937. He married in March, 1936, and there is one child. His wife was a former chorus girl and dancer. After he resigned from the police force he went to New York city for a time. The morning of July 27, 1938, he returned to Detroit and, upon being informed by his wife that she wanted a divorce, he deliberately started out to get drunk, claims he succeeded, and wakened in the prisoner's ward in Receiving Hospital with a long cut on his scalp.
The evening of July 27, 1938, his wife was engaged in singing at a restaurant, and the prosecution claims that in the course of the evening defendant came there and, while having a talk with his wife shortly after midnight, slapped her and, upon her screaming and running away from him, he pulled out his revolver, pointed it at his wife, but was seized by others, and in the scuffle two shots were fired.
Defendant prosecutes review by appeal.
